workout_file.description: Foundation training: Relatively low intensity ride with goal of spending a large proportion of the ride into Endurance Zone 2.
workout_file.name: Week 2.1 - Foundation

textevent.message: Welcome back to week 2 of the 6-week Beginner FTP Builder!
We have some more Foundation training in store for today, but first, let's get warmed up.
We'll be doing our usual 10min progressive warmup today, so let's start shaking things out a bit.
Remember, foundation training, or zone 2 training, is a crucial component of this workout plan.
And we're aiming to increase further the time spent in that zone today.
That's halfway! Let's run down what's in store today...
So, as I already mentioned, today we're going to be doing a ton of work in Zone 2.
The plan is to do 5, 6min intervals, with 2min recovery in between.
So, a total of 30min at zone 2 today which is another 5min more compared to last week :-)
Like last week, we'll also be breaking up the intervals with some cadence and positional work.
Let's continue to warm up and shake out the muscles a bit.
Okay, in 30sec, we'll start our first interval.
Let's aim for a comfortable cadence for the entirety of this first interval.
Let's use this first minute to adjust to the pace and get into things today.
Great work so far! That's 2min down and 4 to go.
Halfway through! Let's do a quick form check: Shoulders relaxed, elbows bent slightly, and a light grip on the bars.
Last minute! You're making this first one look like a piece of cake, great work!
Keep the power on all the way to the arch!
Nicely done! Let's take a short, 2min, recovery now, and get ready for the next effort.
Coming up next, we're going to be using a slow cadence of 70 RPM and focusing on the pedal stroke.
Start bringing that cadence down again.
Let's focus on the 'pull' phase of the pedal stroke for this first minute.
Good! Now, switch your focus to the 'kick' phase of the pedal stroke.
Combine both the 'pull' and 'kick' portions now and make them smooth.
Excellent! Now add the 'push' into the 'pull' and 'kick'.
And now add the 'scrape' portion, so we have all 4 quadrants working.
Keep the pedal stroke circular for this last minute.
Nice work! That's 2 down and 3 to go. Spin the legs out nice and easy again here.
Ready for some fast cadence work next? I hope so!
We're aiming for 100 RPM next for the entire interval.
Let's make it happen here! Bring the cadence way up, but prevent any bouncing in the saddle.
Is your backside planted in the saddle? Make sure you're not sacrificing form for cadence.
That's halfway through! Keep it up, and don't let your cadence drop off now.
Keep the leg speed high for this final minute, and if you can, bring it up another 2-3 RPM.
Great job! Let's take another couple of minutes easy here.
Next up, let's get some positional work done again.
Grab onto your drops or get into your aero bars...
And let's work on our on-bike flexibility and try to reduce our frontal area.
Cadence is whatever floats your boat here :-)
Aim to stay in your aero position for the entire interval, but if you need to come out of it, that's fine.
That's halfway through this interval. Try to get that body and head down and reduce your frontal area.
Imagine you're cutting through the wind!
Last minute! Way to go! Keep yourself locked into this position.
Keep locked in right to the arch.
We're flying through this workout! Just 1 more interval to go today.
For this final effort, we're going to do a fast/low cadence split.
The first half will be at 100 RPM, and the second at 70 RPM. Ready?
Bring your cadence way up again, but I don't want any bouncing or lurching in the saddle again.
Keep yourself comfortable at this high cadence.
So, shoulders relaxed, elbows slightly bent light grip on the bars.
1min to go, then we're going to reduce the cadence to 70 RPM.
Start bringing your cadence down...
Make the transition smooth here. Don't let your cadence drop immediately.
Can you still separate the quadrants of the pedal stroke out under fatigue?
See if you can over the next 2min. Which quadrant you choose is entirely up to you.
Last minute! Keep grinding away here and keep that pedal stroke as smooth as possible.
Hit the arch, and we're done!
Excellent work! Let's bring the power down and cadence back up to something comfortable.
And start our 5min cool down today.
As always, excellent work today and way to push yourself to improve your cadence range and pedal stroke.
As well as increase your total zone 2 duration.
Be sure to replenish and rehydrate before our next session, and we'll see you next time!
